summary: FOLFOX is a standard adjuvant and palliative regimen for colorectal cancer combining 5-FU, leucovorin, and oxaliplatin. Primary concerns include peripheral neuropathy and myelosuppression.

doseModifications.diarrhea: Dose reduce 5-FU by 25% for grade 3+ diarrhea
doseModifications.neuropathy: Reduce oxaliplatin 25% for grade 2, hold for grade 3+

summary: Standard first-line chemotherapy for advanced non-small cell lung cancer. Combines carboplatin with paclitaxel for optimal efficacy with manageable toxicity profile.
Standard first-line treatment for diffuse large B-cell lymphoma combining rituximab with CHOP chemotherapy. Highly effective immunochemotherapy regimen.

doseModifications.cardiotoxicity: Monitor LVEF, reduce doxorubicin if LVEF drops

referenceList: British Committee for Standards in Haematology

summary: Standard neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy for muscle-invasive bladder cancer. Combines cisplatin with gemcitabine for optimal efficacy.

hydration: Normal saline 1L pre and post cisplatin

summary: Bleomycin, Etoposide, and Cisplatin regimen for testicular cancer. Gold standard treatment with excellent cure rates for good and intermediate risk disease.
Standard regimen for extensive stage small cell lung cancer and limited stage disease with concurrent radiotherapy.

FEC-D (5-Fluorouracil, Epirubicin, Cyclophosphamide followed by Docetaxel) is a NCCN Category 1 sequential regimen for early-stage breast cancer. This European-developed protocol offers an alternative to AC-T with different toxicity profile.
Early-stage or locally advanced breast cancer

criteria.Other: Adequate organ function, no active infections
criteria.Cardiac: LVEF ≥50% or within institutional normal limits

doseModifications.mucositis: Hold for grade 3+ mucositis, resume with dose reduction
doseModifications.neuropathy: Reduce docetaxel by 25% for grade 2, discontinue for grade 3+
doseModifications.neutropenia: Hold treatment if ANC <1.0, resume with growth factor support
doseModifications.cardiotoxicity: Discontinue if LVEF drops >10% from baseline or <50%

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to anthracyclines or taxanes
Prior cumulative anthracycline dose >300 mg/m² doxorubicin equivalent

summary: Alternative first-line regimen for advanced NSCLC, particularly in patients with contraindications to taxanes.
Capecitabine and Oxaliplatin combination for adjuvant colorectal cancer treatment. Oral convenience with IV oxaliplatin.
Second-line treatment for metastatic colorectal cancer with irinotecan, 5-FU, and leucovorin.
Standard first-line treatment for epithelial ovarian cancer following optimal debulking surgery.
Concurrent chemoradiotherapy regimen for locally advanced cervical cancer with weekly cisplatin.
Standard first-line treatment for classical Hodgkin lymphoma with excellent cure rates and manageable toxicity.

cardiac_protection: Consider dexrazoxane if cumulative dose high

summary: Pediatric-inspired acute lymphoblastic leukemia protocol for adults with intensive induction and consolidation.
Doxorubicin, Ifosfamide, and Mesna regimen for high-grade soft tissue sarcomas with curative intent.
Standard adjuvant treatment for glioblastoma following surgery and radiotherapy with concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide.

drugs.name: Temozolomide
drugs.schedule: Daily during RT, then 150-200 mg/m² days 1-5 q28d

doseModifications.myelosuppression: Reduce dose if ANC <1.5 or platelets <100k

summary: Standard first-line chemotherapy for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with proven survival benefit.

treatment.cycles: Every 21 days for up to 10 cycles

summary: Methotrexate, Vinblastine, Doxorubicin, Cisplatin for muscle-invasive bladder cancer with curative intent.
Docetaxel, Cisplatin, 5-FU induction chemotherapy for locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
Vincristine, Etoposide, Prednisolone, Doxorubicin for pediatric Hodgkin lymphoma with reduced late effects.
Anti-PD-1 immunotherapy for advanced melanoma with durable responses and manageable immune-related adverse events.

treatment.cycles: Continue until progression or unacceptable toxicity

doseModifications.irAEs: Hold for grade 2+, steroids for grade 3+

summary: Traditional chemotherapy for metastatic melanoma with modest response rates but established safety profile.
Bortezomib, Lenalidomide, Dexamethasone induction for newly diagnosed multiple myeloma with excellent response rates.

doseModifications.neuropathy: Reduce bortezomib dose or change to weekly

summary: Multi-kinase inhibitor for advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with proven survival benefit in Child-Pugh A cirrhosis.
Intensive chemotherapy for metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma in fit patients with excellent performance status.
Epirubicin, Cisplatin, 5-FU for advanced gastric and esophageal adenocarcinoma with curative or palliative intent.
Multi-targeted tyrosine kinase inhibitor for advanced renal cell carcinoma with proven survival benefit.
Procarbazine, CCNU, Vincristine for oligodendrogliomas and mixed gliomas with 1p/19q codeletion.
Multi-kinase inhibitor for radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer with significant clinical benefit.
Long-acting somatostatin analog for symptom control and tumor stabilization in neuroendocrine tumors.
Carboplatin and Paclitaxel with concurrent radiotherapy for locally advanced esophageal cancer per CROSS trial.
Standard chemotherapy for advanced cholangiocarcinoma and gallbladder cancer with proven survival benefit.
Dose-adjusted EPOCH for aggressive B-cell lymphomas including double-hit and CNS lymphomas.

doseModifications.neutropenia: Dose escalation based on nadir ANC

summary: Anti-PD-1 immunotherapy for advanced NSCLC after platinum-based chemotherapy with durable responses.
Intensive induction chemotherapy for locally advanced head and neck cancer with high response rates.

supportiveCare.nutritional_support: PEG tube early if severe mucositis

summary: First-line chemotherapy for non-squamous NSCLC with excellent efficacy and manageable toxicity profile.

preMedications.vitamin_supplementation: Folic acid 400mcg daily, B12 1000mcg IM q9weeks

summary: Rituximab with CVP for indolent B-cell lymphomas in elderly or frail patients.
Anti-VEGF therapy combined with FOLFOX for metastatic colorectal cancer with improved progression-free survival.
Anti-EGFR therapy with FOLFIRI for RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer.
Combination immunotherapy for advanced melanoma with enhanced response rates but increased toxicity.

interactions.immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy but needed for irAEs

summary: Second-line chemotherapy for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer after docetaxel failure.
Androgen biosynthesis inhibitor for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with survival benefit.
Androgen receptor antagonist for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with CNS penetration.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: Nanoparticle albumin-bound paclitaxel with gemcitabine for metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
Combination immunotherapy and anti-angiogenic therapy for advanced hepatocellular carcinoma.
EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor for EGFR-mutated advanced NSCLC with excellent response rates.

preMedications.patient_education: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after food

summary: Third-generation EGFR TKI for T790M-positive NSCLC with CNS penetration and improved tolerability.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: ALK inhibitor for ALK-rearranged advanced NSCLC with excellent CNS activity and response rates.

postMedications.visual_effects: Usually transient, reduce dose if persistent

summary: Alternative to cisplatin-based therapy for ovarian cancer in patients with renal impairment or neuropathy.
Rituximab with bendamustine for indolent lymphomas with excellent response rates and manageable toxicity.
Second-generation TKI for CML resistant or intolerant to imatinib with improved potency.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

interactions.acid_reducing_agents: Take dasatinib 2 hours before or after

summary: Second-generation TKI for CML with excellent molecular responses and specific cardiovascular monitoring.
Oral cytoreductive agent for CML when TKI therapy not suitable or as bridge therapy.
Gentle immunochemotherapy for elderly patients with CLL or indolent lymphomas.
FCR regimen for CLL with excellent response rates but significant immunosuppression.
BTK inhibitor for CLL and mantle cell lymphoma with excellent efficacy and unique toxicity profile.
BCL-2 inhibitor for CLL with excellent efficacy but requiring careful tumor lysis syndrome prevention.
Anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody with FOLFIRI for RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer.
Anti-VEGF fusion protein with FOLFIRI for metastatic colorectal cancer after oxaliplatin failure.
Multi-kinase inhibitor for refractory metastatic colorectal cancer with modest survival benefit.

Ribociclib-Letrozole is a NCCN Category 1 first-line regimen for hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative metastatic breast cancer. This CDK4/6 inhibitor combination has demonstrated overall survival benefit in the MONALEESA trials.
Postmenopausal women or premenopausal with ovarian suppression

criteria.Cardiac: QTcF <450 msec, no significant cardiac disease

doseModifications.neutropenia: Hold for ANC <1.0, resume with dose reduction
doseModifications.qt_prolongation: Hold if QTcF >480 msec, resume when <450 msec with dose reduction

alternate_options.hepatotoxicity: Consider abemaciclib or different CDK4/6 inhibitor

cycleInfo.administration_time: 21 days on, 7 days off ribociclib + continuous letrozole

contraindications: QTcF >450 msec or history of QT prolongation

summary: Abemaciclib-Fulvestrant is a NCCN Category 1 regimen for hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative metastatic breast cancer after prior endocrine therapy. This combination is effective for endocrine-resistant disease.

doseModifications.diarrhea: Hold for grade 3+ diarrhea, resume with dose reduction and antidiarrheals
doseModifications.fulvestrant: Standard 500 mg IM monthly, no dose modifications typically needed
doseModifications.neutropenia: Hold for grade 3+ neutropenia, resume with dose reduction

alternate_options.neutropenia: Consider growth factor support or alternative CDK4/6 inhibitor
alternate_options.progression: Consider chemotherapy or other targeted agents
alternate_options.diarrhea_intolerance: Switch to palbociclib or ribociclib + fulvestrant

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to abemaciclib or fulvestrant
Severe diarrhea or inflammatory bowel disease

summary: Fulvestrant is a NCCN Category 1 selective estrogen receptor degrader for hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer after prior endocrine therapy. This injection provides effective second-line endocrine treatment.

criteria.Other: Adequate performance status, no visceral crisis
criteria.Prior_therapy: Prior AI or tamoxifen with progression

dose_reductions.standard: 500 mg IM monthly, no standard dose reductions

alternate_options.visceral_crisis: Consider chemotherapy for rapid disease control

doseModifications.systemic_reactions: Hold for severe reactions, resume with premedication
doseModifications.injection_reactions: Local measures, consider antihistamines, continue treatment

contraindications: Bleeding disorders (relative contraindication for IM injection)

summary: Alpha-emitting radiopharmaceutical for bone metastases in castration-resistant prostate cancer.
Targeted radiopharmaceutical therapy for PSMA-positive metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.
PARP inhibitor for BRCA-mutated ovarian cancer maintenance or treatment setting.
PARP inhibitor for ovarian cancer maintenance regardless of BRCA status with individualized dosing.
Immunotherapy combined with chemotherapy for advanced NSCLC first-line treatment with improved survival.
Second-generation ALK inhibitor for ALK-rearranged NSCLC with excellent CNS activity and tolerability.
Second-generation ALK inhibitor for ALK-rearranged NSCLC with activity against crizotinib-resistant mutations.
Third-generation ALK inhibitor for ALK-rearranged NSCLC with excellent CNS penetration and activity against resistance mutations.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: Second-generation ALK inhibitor for ALK-rearranged NSCLC with unique safety profile requiring dose escalation.
Irreversible EGFR inhibitor for EGFR-mutated NSCLC with activity against uncommon mutations.
Second-generation irreversible EGFR inhibitor for EGFR-mutated NSCLC with survival benefit.
First-generation EGFR inhibitor for EGFR-mutated NSCLC with favorable toxicity profile.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: Marine-derived alkaloid for advanced soft tissue sarcoma after anthracycline failure.
Multi-kinase inhibitor for advanced soft tissue sarcoma with anti-angiogenic activity.
Anti-PDGFR-alpha monoclonal antibody with doxorubicin for advanced soft tissue sarcoma.
Microtubule inhibitor for advanced liposarcoma and leiomyosarcoma with unique mechanism of action.
High-dose ifosfamide with doxorubicin for high-grade sarcomas requiring intensive therapy.
First-line tyrosine kinase inhibitor for gastrointestinal stromal tumors with KIT or PDGFRA mutations.
Second-line multi-kinase inhibitor for GIST after imatinib resistance or intolerance.
Third-line multi-kinase inhibitor for GIST after imatinib and sunitinib failure.
Fourth-line switch-control kinase inhibitor for GIST after multiple prior therapies.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: Selective KIT and PDGFRA inhibitor for GIST with exon 18 PDGFRA mutations.
Anti-VEGF therapy with chemotherapy for advanced ovarian cancer with improved progression-free survival.
PARP inhibitor maintenance therapy for platinum-sensitive recurrent ovarian cancer.
Anti-PD-L1 immunotherapy maintenance for unresectable stage III NSCLC after chemoradiotherapy.

interactions.immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy but needed for irAEs

summary: Atezolizumab-Nab-Paclitaxel is a NCCN Category 1 regimen for PD-L1 positive metastatic triple-negative breast cancer in the first-line setting. This immunotherapy combination improves overall survival in selected patients.

criteria.Biomarkers: Triple-negative, PD-L1 positive (≥1% IC by SP142)
criteria.Prior_therapy: No prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease

biomarker_requirements.PD_L1: Positive (≥1% immune cells by SP142 assay)

doseModifications.hepatitis: Permanently discontinue atezolizumab for grade 3+ hepatitis
doseModifications.pneumonitis: Permanently discontinue atezolizumab for grade 2+ pneumonitis
doseModifications.immune_toxicity: Hold atezolizumab for grade 2+ immune-related AEs, treat with steroids

alternate_options.pd_l1_negative: Consider chemotherapy alone or clinical trials
alternate_options.immune_toxicity: Continue nab-paclitaxel alone if atezolizumab discontinued

ongoing: Monitor for delayed immune toxicities up to 1 year post-treatment

contraindications: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunosuppression
Known hypersensitivity to atezolizumab or nab-paclitaxel

summary: Anti-EGFR therapy with irinotecan for RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer after 5-FU failure.

Tucatinib-Trastuzumab-Capecitabine is a NCCN Category 1 regimen for HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer after prior anti-HER2 therapy. This oral HER2 tyrosine kinase inhibitor combination shows excellent CNS activity and overcomes trastuzumab resistance.

criteria.CNS: Brain metastases allowed and specifically studied
criteria.Prior_therapy: Prior trastuzumab and taxane (adjuvant or metastatic)

biomarker_requirements.HER2: Positive (IHC 3+ or FISH amplified, HER2/CEP17 ratio ≥2.0)

doseModifications.diarrhea: Hold for grade 3+ diarrhea, resume with dose reduction and antidiarrheals
doseModifications.lvef_decline: Hold trastuzumab for LVEF drop >10% or <45%
doseModifications.hepatotoxicity: Hold for grade 3+ ALT/AST elevation, may require permanent discontinuation

alternate_options.cns_progression: Consider stereotactic radiosurgery with continued systemic therapy

doseModifications.hand_foot_syndrome: Hold for grade 2+ HFS, resume with dose reduction

every_3_months: CNS imaging for brain mets patients

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to tucatinib, trastuzumab, or capecitabine

summary: Alpelisib-Fulvestrant is a NCCN Category 1 regimen for PIK3CA-mutated, hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer after prior endocrine therapy. This PI3K inhibitor combination targets specific molecular alterations.

criteria.Other: Adequate glucose control, no diabetes complications
criteria.Biomarkers: ER+ and/or PR+, HER2-negative, PIK3CA mutation

doseModifications.rash: Hold for grade 3+ rash, treat with topical steroids
doseModifications.diarrhea: Hold for grade 3+ diarrhea, aggressive antidiarrheal management
doseModifications.hyperglycemia: Hold for glucose >500 mg/dL, resume with antidiabetic management

alternate_options.diabetes_intolerance: Consider other targeted agents or CDK4/6 inhibitors

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to alpelisib or fulvestrant

summary: Oral nucleoside antimetabolite for refractory metastatic colorectal cancer after standard therapies.
Concurrent chemoradiotherapy for squamous cell carcinoma of the anal canal with curative intent.
Squamous cell carcinoma of anal canal
Concurrent chemoradiotherapy for head and neck squamous cell carcinoma when cisplatin contraindicated.
Anti-EGFR therapy with radiotherapy for head and neck squamous cell carcinoma when chemotherapy contraindicated.
Anti-PD-1 immunotherapy for recurrent or metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

interactions.immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy but needed for irAEs

summary: Anti-PD-1 immunotherapy for platinum-refractory recurrent or metastatic head and neck cancer.

interactions.immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy but needed for irAEs

summary: Single-agent methotrexate for recurrent or metastatic head and neck cancer when combination therapy not suitable.
VMP regimen for newly diagnosed multiple myeloma in transplant-ineligible patients with excellent response rates.

doseModifications.neuropathy: Reduce bortezomib dose or change to weekly

summary: KRd regimen for newly diagnosed multiple myeloma with improved efficacy over bortezomib-based therapy.

doseModifications.cardiotoxicity: Monitor LVEF, reduce dose if drops

summary: Anti-CD38 monoclonal antibody with VMP for newly diagnosed multiple myeloma transplant-ineligible patients.
Third-generation immunomodulatory drug with dexamethasone for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
Anti-SLAMF7 monoclonal antibody with lenalidomide and dexamethasone for relapsed/refractory myeloma.
Oral proteasome inhibitor with lenalidomide and dexamethasone for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
Selective nuclear export inhibitor with dexamethasone for heavily pretreated relapsed/refractory myeloma.
Anti-BCMA antibody-drug conjugate for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma with unique ocular toxicity.

doseModifications.keratopathy: Dose delay or reduction for grade 2+

summary: Peptide-drug conjugate delivering melphalan selectively to myeloma cells for relapsed/refractory disease.
Bispecific T-cell engager targeting BCMA for heavily pretreated relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
CAR-T cell therapy targeting BCMA for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma with exceptional response rates.
CAR-T cell therapy targeting BCMA for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma with durable responses.
Alternative platinum-based therapy for ovarian cancer when carboplatin contraindicated due to hypersensitivity.
Weekly topotecan for platinum-resistant recurrent ovarian cancer with improved tolerability profile.
Pegylated liposomal doxorubicin for platinum-resistant recurrent ovarian cancer with reduced cardiotoxicity.
Weekly paclitaxel for platinum-resistant recurrent ovarian cancer with improved neuropathy profile.
Antibody-drug conjugate targeting folate receptor alpha for platinum-resistant ovarian cancer.
Anastrozole is a NCCN Category 1 aromatase inhibitor for hormone receptor-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women. Alternative to letrozole with similar efficacy profile.
Exemestane is a NCCN Category 1 steroidal aromatase inhibitor for hormone receptor-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women. Alternative AI with different side effect profile.
LHRH agonist for advanced prostate cancer providing castrate levels of testosterone.
Non-steroidal antiandrogen for advanced prostate cancer as monotherapy or with LHRH agonist.
Non-steroidal antiandrogen for advanced prostate cancer with hepatotoxicity monitoring required.

toxicityMonitoring.hepatotoxicity: Weekly LFTs first month, then monthly

summary: GnRH antagonist for advanced prostate cancer providing immediate testosterone suppression without flare.
Androgen receptor antagonist for non-metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with metastasis-free survival benefit.

toxicityMonitoring.metastasis_surveillance: CT and bone scan every 4 months

summary: Androgen receptor antagonist for non-metastatic CRPC and metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: 5-alpha reductase inhibitor for benign prostatic hyperplasia and prostate cancer risk reduction.
Dual 5-alpha reductase inhibitor for BPH and prostate cancer risk reduction with enhanced efficacy.
Androgen receptor antagonist for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with survival benefit.

cycleInfo.administration_time: Once daily with or without food

summary: Pembrolizumab with chemoradiation for stage III-IVA cervical cancer per NCCN v2.2025 KEYNOTE-A18

drugs.name: Pembrolizumab
drugs.schedule: Q3 weeks during RT then maintenance

cycleInfo.maintenance_phase: Q3 weeks up to 35 total cycles

summary: Perioperative FLOT for resectable esophagogastric adenocarcinoma per NCCN v1.2025 ESOPEC trial

criteria.stage: cT2N0 or any cT3-4a or cN+

docetaxel: Dexamethasone 8mg PO BID x3 days starting day before

summary: Lisocabtagene maraleucel CAR-T therapy for relapsed/refractory CLL per NCCN v3.2025

doseModifications.CRS: Tocilizumab and corticosteroids per ASTCT guidelines

contraindications: Prior allogeneic stem cell transplant <100 days

summary: Hepatic arterial infusion chemotherapy with FOLFOX for unresectable HCC per NCCN v1.2025
referenceList: Phase III HAIC vs TACE trial

summary: Gemcitabine plus oxaliplatin for advanced hepatocellular carcinoma per NCCN v1.2025
Lenvatinib monotherapy for unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma per NCCN v1.2025

cycleInfo.monitoring_frequency: Weekly first month then q2 weeks

summary: Neoadjuvant FOLFIRINOX for borderline resectable pancreatic adenocarcinoma per NCCN v2.2025
Modified FOLFIRINOX for metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma per NCCN v2.2025
Gemcitabine plus capecitabine for pancreatic adenocarcinoma per NCCN v2.2025
Cisplatin plus 5-fluorouracil with concurrent radiation for anal cancer per NCCN v4.2025
Capecitabine plus mitomycin with concurrent radiation for anal cancer per NCCN v4.2025

toxicityMonitoring.dermatologic: Hand-foot syndrome grading and radiation dermatitis

contraindications: History of severe hypersensitivity to taxanes

summary: Sorafenib for radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer per NCCN v1.2025

cycleInfo.monitoring_frequency: Weekly first month then q2 weeks

summary: Cabozantinib for radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer per NCCN v1.2025

cycleInfo.monitoring_frequency: Weekly first 4 weeks then q2 weeks

summary: Selpercatinib for RET fusion-positive thyroid cancer per NCCN v1.2025

doseModifications.grade_3_AEs: Hold until grade 1 then reduce dose

cycleInfo.monitoring_frequency: Weekly first month then q2 weeks
